summary: Eileen Copeland (also referred to as Eileen G. Dinneen/Copeland) is identified in the HSCA staff payroll records. The documents indicate her involvement with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents primarily consist of payroll authorizations, certifications, and related notifications from the Assassination Records Review Board. The records detail staff names, positions, and salaries, indicating Copeland's role as a staff member during the HSCA's operations in the late 1970s. The documents also mention the postponement of the release of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy.
significance: Eileen Copeland's significance lies in her role as a staff member within the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The payroll records provide insight into the staffing and financial aspects of the HSCA's work.
